original_body_lines: Cut a fresh watermelon into small pieces and blend them to extract the juice. Strain the juice to remove any pulp.
After cleansing your face, soak a cotton pad with the watermelon juice and gently sweep the soaked cotton pad across your face, avoiding the eye area.
Allow the watermelon juice to air dry on your face or, if you prefer, rinse it off after a few minutes.
Follow up with your regular moisturizer to lock in the hydration.
Watermelon is composed mostly of water, making it an excellent natural hydrator for the skin.
Packed with vitamins A and C, watermelon juice helps promote skin regeneration and collagen production.
The presence of antioxidants in watermelon helps combat free radicals, reducing signs of ageing and damage from environmental factors.
Watermelon has a calming effect on the skin, making it suitable for even sensitive skin types.
The natural astringent properties of watermelon help in toning the skin and reducing the appearance of pores.
Applying watermelon juice gives an instant cooling and refreshing sensation, making it a pleasant addition to your skincare routine.
